result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:03 AM Defendant Trayvon D Taylor not in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Trayvon D Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Griffis states his client is in IL prison and unable to be transported here. 
State is working with the prison to see how to transport defendant to Waukesha County Jail.
Atty Griffis would request a new hearing date in this matter to go over further discovery.
State does not object to a new status date. 
State will request defendant be brought here for the next hearing from FCI Penkin.
All parties agree to a plea and sentencing date.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:26 AM Defendant Trayvon D Taylor in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Thompson verifies the offer will be withdrawn if we proceed to a preliminary hearing.  Atty. Griffis states defendant wishes to proceed with the preliminary hearing.  Waukesha County Detective Ryan Roeglin sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Thompson.  Cross examination by Atty. Griffis.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Thompson moves for bind over.  Atty. Griffis makes closing statements.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
